reference.ref: Chen, C.H., Józwik, A. A sample set condensation algorithm for the class sensitive artificial neural network (1996) Pattern Recognition Letters, 17, pp. 819‐823.

generalDescription.type: Preprocess Method. Data Reduction. Prototype Generation. Noise Filter.
generalDescription.objective: Reduce the size of the training set without losing precision or accuracy in order to a posterior classification
generalDescription.howWork: 1. It takes the two farthest prototypes (a, b), and make partition of the set in order of distance to a and b. 2. Add that sets to C. 2. Find the least homogeneus part. It is, the part which its prototypes has more class-similarity. 3. Take the set with two farthest points of that least homogeneus set. It will be used in 1. 4. Make the average prototype of each prototype set present in C. 5. Add them to the reduced set.

parameterSpec.param: Percentage of prototypes: Real value. Desired size of the resulting set as percentage of training set size.
